From LeanCamCombi


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [6d7b1302f9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13952/commits/6d7b1302f945c4ee3c02da2e5e026f8a08e5cfaf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Fintype.sum_smul_sum`
`+ convexHull_pi`
`+ convexHull_vadd`
`+ mem_convexHull_iff_exists_fintype`
`+ mem_convexHull_of_exists_fintype`
`+ mem_convexHull_pi`
`+ prod_sum`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9895591488/job/27335851806)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9895591488/job/27335852843)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hw₀ : ∀ i, 0 ≤ w i) (hw₁ : ∑ i, w i = 1) (hz : ∀ i, z i ∈ s) (hx : ∑ i, w i • z i = x) : ```
The statement of `sum_smul_sum` changed to match `sum_mul_sum`.
Why not put this before `mem_convexHull_iff_exists_fintype` so that you can use it to prove one direction?
Doesn't actually golf anything, but okay
Is there a `fiberwise` lemma somewhere for this?

Yes I can apply `sum_fiberwise` (or one of its relatives) but there is no way for it to return me the correct RHS (unless I basically write the equality I need as a very specific lemma) so then I need to use `sum_bij` (or one of its relatives) anyway.

If you find a better way, I'm all ears.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Product of convex hulls
